content:
• Wednesday, September 19, 2012
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI) -4.8% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. The...

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI) -4.8% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. The solar module/battery charger maker, which has been steadily bleeding cash, only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes." (PR) (S-3)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) says it expects to take a $25M charge associated with its reduction in...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) says it expects to take a $25M charge associated with its reduction in headcount for employee severance and other related termination benefits during the second half of 2012 and into 2013. As previously disclosed, the company expects implementation of its restructuring plan to be completed by mid-2013. Shares +2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • CLC

    More on Clarcor (NYSE:CLC): FQ3 misses on all counts despite better sales, largely due to higher...

    More on Clarcor (NYSE:CLC): FQ3 misses on all counts despite better sales, largely due to higher operating costs and a 3% jump in its tax rate. The company also lowers its FY12 EPS guidance to $2.35 - $2.45, down from the previous guidance range of $2.50 - $2.65, and below the consensus of $2.58. Shares -3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • AIR

    AAR (NYSE:AIR): FQ1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $550.5M beats by $14M. Shares +5.5%...

    AAR (NYSE:AIR): FQ1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $550.5M beats by $14M. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • CIM

    In addition to its dividend declaration, Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) also said that as of June...

    In addition to its dividend declaration, Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) also said that as of June 30, its GAAP book value was estimated at $3.08 per share and its economic book value was $2.87 per share. Shares +3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 6 Comments
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (NYSEMKT:CQP) announces an underwritten public offering of 8M common...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (NYSEMKT:CQP) announces an underwritten public offering of 8M common units representing limited partner interests. CQP says it will use net proceeds to repay a portion of a $550M note issued by Sabine Pass LNG. CQP -5.1%, LNG -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • BBBY

    More on Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Earnings of $0.98/share up 5.4% Y/Y. FQ2 comparable...

    More on Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Earnings of $0.98/share up 5.4% Y/Y. FQ2 comparable store sales +3.5% vs. +5.6% in 2011 FQ2. FQ3 earnings guidance is roughly inline with previous guidance at $0.99-1.04. The miss on the bottom line gives investors an excuse to sell and they don't pass it up. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • SCS

    More on Steelcase (NYSE:SCS): Q2 beats across the board with earnings more than doubling as the...

    More on Steelcase (NYSE:SCS): Q2 beats across the board with earnings more than doubling as the office-furniture maker posted broad-based sales growth and fewer restructuring charges. For the current quarter, it sees Q3 EPS coming in between $0.16 - $0.20 on revenue of $710M - $735M, below consensus estimates of $0.24 per share on $752.67M revenue. Shares +9.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • APOG

    Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG): Q2 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $175.9M (+6% Y/Y)...

    Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG): Q2 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $175.9M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • NSC

    Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) lowers its Q3 earnings outlook due to declines in certain markets...

    Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) lowers its Q3 earnings outlook due to declines in certain markets and lower revenues from fuel surcharges. NSC expects decreased coal and merchandise shipments, offset in part by growth in intermodal volumes, to reduce revenues by ~$120M Q/Q. NSC -5.8% AH, other rails also move lower: CSX -4.8%, KSU -3.5%, UNP -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 9 Comments
  • CIM

    Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) declares $0.09/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous....

    Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) declares $0.09/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 13.48%. For shareholders of record Oct 01. Payable Oct 29. Ex-div date Sep 27. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q2 EPS of $0.98 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $2.59B (+12.1%...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q2 EPS of $0.98 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $2.59B (+12.1% Y/Y) beats by $50M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ3 EPS of $0.58 in-line. Revenue of $1.08B in-line. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ3 EPS of $0.58 in-line. Revenue of $1.08B in-line. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +3.8%) spike higher in late trading after CEO Ron Johnson says the...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +3.8%) spike higher in late trading after CEO Ron Johnson says the retailer's "Shops" are doing 20% better than the rest of the store. Shares were as high as +11% before it became clearer that the retailer's overall sales could still be subdued with the stores concept still a work in progress. Johnson's comments were made at an Open House Tour event for investors and analysts. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 11 Comments
  • WM

    Waste Management (WM -3.4%) is downgraded to Underweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which says...

    Waste Management (WM -3.4%) is downgraded to Underweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which says industry conditions have become more challenging due to declines in recycled commodity prices and its exposure to spot electricity prices. The firm also says a lower cash flow outlook cuts into WM's ability to increase dividends or buy back shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • MON

    "Monsanto’s (MON +2.8%) doing a lot of things right," OptionMonster’s Jon Najarian...

    "Monsanto’s (MON +2.8%) doing a lot of things right," OptionMonster’s Jon Najarian tells CNBC, adding the stock's two-year rise could continue as demand grows for MON’s genetically engineered, drought-resistant seeds. Shares are strong today, as investors focus on Goldman's upgrade rather than a study that said rats developed tumors after being exposed to certain MON products.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -3.2%) is under pressure again after S&P places its credit...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -3.2%) is under pressure again after S&P places its credit rating on watch for a downgrade and its planned production cuts, but UBS says ANR's repositioning news bodes well and shares should be higher. The firm cuts its 2012, 2013 and 2014 EPS estimates as well as its stock target price (to $15 from $19) while maintaining its Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint (S +7%) and Clearwire (CLWR +8.3%) jump after the Street takes kindly to Sprint CEO Dan...

    Sprint (S +7%) and Clearwire (CLWR +8.3%) jump after the Street takes kindly to Sprint CEO Dan Hesse's Goldman conference remarks. Hesse forecasts "significant consolidation" will hit the U.S. mobile industry (previous); claims the carrier has doubled its retention rate for defecting Nextel subs as it prepares to shut down Nextel's network; and suggests Sprint is open to making spectrum purchases. M&A targets Leap Wireless (LEAP +2.5%) and MetroPCS (PCS +3.9%) are also higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +11.1%) adds to this morning's gains after CEO/maitre d' Andrew Mason makes a CNBC...

    Groupon (GRPN +11.1%) adds to this morning's gains after CEO/maitre d' Andrew Mason makes a CNBC appearance to discuss his company's card reader launch. "We're more than just a coupon company," Mason asserts, while adding Groupon isn't focused on near-term profits as much as growth for its reader. This seems a good time to point out 20.3% of Groupon's float was shorted as of Aug. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • GM

    In the zero-sum game of auto sales, General Motors (GM +1.5%) and German automakers such as BMW...

    In the zero-sum game of auto sales, General Motors (GM +1.5%) and German automakers such as BMW (BAMXY.PK) and Volkswagen (VLKAY.PK) could benefit from the wave of anti-Japan protests across China, while Honda (HMC +1.9%), Toyota (TM +1.0%), and Nissan (OTCPK:NSANY) suffer a loss of market share. The trio of Japanese automakers already reported attacks on dealerships and have cut production in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • UAL

    The rapid-fire drop in oil futures has the shares of airline companies racing higher on margins...

    The rapid-fire drop in oil futures has the shares of airline companies racing higher on margins optimism with a fresh round of fare increases sitting securely in their back pocket. As is often the case with fare hikes, Southwest Airlines stuck its toe in the water before the rest of the sector jumped in. Advancers: UAL +8.6%, LUV +1.9%, JBLU +4.2%, HA +3.3%, SAVE +6.5%, ALGT +3.5%, DAL +4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.1%) is rallying again today after Baird's Colin Sebastian provides a favorable...

    Facebook (FB +3.1%) is rallying again today after Baird's Colin Sebastian provides a favorable take on the company's mobile ad network plans. "Facebook is amassing the most comprehensive user profile database in existence," Sebastian asserts, and this could allow it to "become a more relevant ad network than Yahoo (YHOO) and AOL," as well as take on display ad leader Google (NASDAQ:GOOG).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 4 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.8%) trades higher with another round of chatter cropping...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.8%) trades higher with another round of chatter cropping up that P-E firms are sniffing around. Investors trying to narrow the focus on GMCR to fundamental issues such as patent expirations and accounting may be engaging in an exercise of futility at the moment with momentum traders seeming to have shares handcuffed. GMCR +81% from its July low, -73% from its 52-week high.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CY

    Cypress Semi (CY +0.2%) and Ramtron (RMTR +7.7%) have finally reached a deal. Cypress will...

    Cypress Semi (CY +0.2%) and Ramtron (RMTR +7.7%) have finally reached a deal. Cypress will acquire Ramtron, a pioneer in developing FRAM (predicted for decades to be the memory of the future), for $3.10/share, or $109.8M. Cypress made a $2.48/share offer for Ramtron in June, and raised its bid to $2.68/share and then $2.88/share over time, even though Ramtron posted an ugly Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • KOOL

    ThermoGenesis (KOOL +3.3%) moves up after saying it has signed two new channel partner...

    ThermoGenesis (KOOL +3.3%) moves up after saying it has signed two new channel partner agreements in an effort to enhance its distribution, technical service and clinical support initiatives of its cord blood products. Under the new agreement with HVD Biotech Vertriebs will have exclusive distribution rights for KOOL's AXP AutoXpress System and BioArchive System in 10 European countries.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Standard & Poor's places Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -3%) on CreditWatch negative due...

    Standard & Poor's places Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -3%) on CreditWatch negative due to weaker expected volumes and pricing. The action follows yesterday's announcement of ANR's 2013 production cuts to tonnage in the low-80Ms vs. S&P's previous estimate of ~90M tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor's (QCOR -38.5%) weakness a buying opportunity , says Leerink Swann. The firm says it's...

    Questcor's (QCOR -38.5%) weakness a buying opportunity , says Leerink Swann. The firm says it's confirmed with Aetna (AET -0.3%) that Acthar is reimbursed as a second tier drug, and Acthar sales are still seeing more prescriptions written.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • ETN

    Some comments from Eaton (ETN +1.5%) out of the Citi Global Industrials Conference: Reaffirms...

    Some comments from Eaton (ETN +1.5%) out of the Citi Global Industrials Conference: Reaffirms FY12 EPS of $4.09 - $4.39, Street consensus is at $4.31; Sees end markets growth of 3%-4%; After recent acquisitions will be out of M&A for a while.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • SBOW

    Swift Energy (SFY -4.7%) sinks after lowering its full-year production forecast by 225K boe from...

    Swift Energy (SFY -4.7%) sinks after lowering its full-year production forecast by 225K boe from prior estimates. SFY says repairs to infrastructure following Hurricane Isaac are not expected to require significant capital expenditures, but prolonged poor weather has further delayed the resumption of field-wide operations at Lake Washington.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +6.2%) surges above $31 after Pac Crest starts coverage with an Outperform and...

    Fusion-io (FIO +6.2%) surges above $31 after Pac Crest starts coverage with an Outperform and $38 target. Shares of the server flash memory hardware vendor are now at levels last seen in March.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • MEMP

    Memorial Production Partners (MEMP +4.9%) agrees to acquire east Texas oil and gas properties...

    Memorial Production Partners (MEMP +4.9%) agrees to acquire east Texas oil and gas properties from Goodrich Petroleum (GDP -1.4%) for $95M. Estimated net proved reserves of ~139 Bcfe; 22% proved developed reserves; current net production ~12.6 MMcfe/day. MEMP also expands its borrowing base to $380M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • LYB

    RBC Capital initiates coverage on the chemicals sector today: LyondellBasell (LYB +1%, Celanese...

    RBC Capital initiates coverage on the chemicals sector today: LyondellBasell (LYB +1%, Celanese (CE +3.8%) and Valspar (VAL +3.4%) are all initiated with an Outperform (I, II, III) and Dow Chemical (DOW +0.1%), DuPont (DD +1%), Eastman Chemical (EMN +0.5%) and PPG Industries (NYSE:PPG) are started at Sector Perform (I, II, III, IV).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • LRCX

    More on chip equipment stocks: Also hurting their cause is a somewhat bearish note from Citi....

    More on chip equipment stocks: Also hurting their cause is a somewhat bearish note from Citi. The firm is downgrading Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX), and cutting estimates for Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) and KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC). However, Citi remains bullish on KLA on expectations the company will benefit from TSMC's (NYSE:TSM) 20nm process investments, and a shift in Apple processor orders from Samsung to TSMC. TSMC is expected to boost its 2013 capex by 35%, partially offsetting Samsung's cutbacks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • SSNLF

    Chip equipment stocks plunge following a report Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) will cut its chip capex by...

    Chip equipment stocks plunge following a report Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) will cut its chip capex by half next year, following a major 2012 increase. AMAT -2%. KLAC -3.6%. LRCX -3.3%. UTEK -2.9%. ASML -2.6%. CYMI -3.1%. Barclays is "highly skeptical" of the report, but does think Samsung's capex could fall by a third. On the flip side, the report is giving a lift to SanDisk (SNDK +3.8%) and Micron (MU +3%), given it bodes well for next year's DRAM and NAND flash supply/demand balances.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • THR

    Thermon Group (THR -4.5%) slides after filing an 8M secondary offering for certain shareholders....

    Thermon Group (THR -4.5%) slides after filing an 8M secondary offering for certain shareholders. Thermon, which provides highly engineered thermal services for energy and chemical processing industries, had around 30.4M shares outstanding as of May 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy (PDCE -4.9%) says its acreage in the Ohio Utica is exceeding expectations in...

    PDC Energy (PDCE -4.9%) says its acreage in the Ohio Utica is exceeding expectations in initial production rates, liquids mix and other measures. But PDC is no longer actively seeking a partner to develop the play because the offers it received didn’t meet its value expectations; it now says development of its Utica position on a stand-alone basis will produce greater long-term value.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • BVSN

    BroadVision (BVSN +29.2%) is taking off in the absence of significant news. Is Jonathan Lebed's...

    BroadVision (BVSN +29.2%) is taking off in the absence of significant news. Is Jonathan Lebed's promotional work responsible yet again?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • NSM

    Specialty mortgage servicers jump - NSM +7.2%, OCN +1.6%, WAC +1.6% - as Compass Point puts a...

    Specialty mortgage servicers jump - NSM +7.2%, OCN +1.6%, WAC +1.6% - as Compass Point puts a Buy on the group due to a "secular shift." As banks are forced to offload their servicing portfolios (at the bottom), these companies should see tremendous growth. Compass Point is just stating what investors in these firms have known for months. All are already sporting fancy YTD gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +5.5%) shares are spiking on a report from Papua New Guinea suggesting an...

    InterOil (IOC +5.5%) shares are spiking on a report from Papua New Guinea suggesting an "important announcement" coming; the news could involve the bidding for an operating stake of IOC's Gulf LNG project and its Elk-Antelope field in the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Shares of Questcor (QCOR) are now down 55% and halted on a circuit breaker.

    Shares of Questcor (QCOR) are now down 55% and halted on a circuit breaker.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • USO

    Oil's tumble continues to be more than a one-day wonder as WTI crude dives another 3% to...

    Oil's tumble continues to be more than a one-day wonder as WTI crude dives another 3% to $92.90/barrel, the lowest price in more than a month, and nearly $8 less than the price it hit following the QE∞ announcement. Monday's excuse for selling was a rumored SPR release; today's is chatter from Saudi Arabia. USO -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -34.5%) is getting hammered this morning on another negative report from Citron...

    Questcor (QCOR -34.5%) is getting hammered this morning on another negative report from Citron Research. Citron is saying that Aetna (AET -0.5%) has dropped almost all coverage of QCOR's drug Achtar for treating multiple sclerosis and nephrotic symdrome, saying that studies found no proof of efficacy to substantiate reimbursement. It will, however, continue to provide reimbursement when treating infantile spasms.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • MAT

    Toy companies get hit by a downgrade from Needham as analyst Sean McGowan warns that the...

    Toy companies get hit by a downgrade from Needham as analyst Sean McGowan warns that the potential for negative surprises in the sector outweighs the upside to buying shares in front of the holiday season. Mattel (MAT -1.8%), Hasbro (HAS -0.9%), and Jakks Pacific (JAKK -4.6%) all trade lower after the firm lowers its rating on the trio to Hold from Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • GNK

    Shipping stocks (GNK +4.6%) soar as news out of China on steel and iron prices has traders...

    Shipping stocks (GNK +4.6%) soar as news out of China on steel and iron prices has traders making bets on select names. Advancers: DRYS +6.8%, PRGN +10.4%, EXM +12.8%, GNK +6.5%, FRO +3.1%, OSG +3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 4 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +7.8%)  jumps on news the company is officially launching its mobile card...

    Groupon (GRPN +7.8%)  jumps on news the company is officially launching its mobile card reader, after months of trialing the product in the Bay Area. Groupon's rates for most swiped transactions are lower than those of market leader Square's. The has led the bearish Rocky Agrawal to think Groupon, which can cross-sell the reader to thousands of daily deals providers, has a chance. But Square, now on an $8B/year run rate, has other advantages, and Groupon is far from alone in challenging it.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta (MLM +2.1%) will need to raise its takeover bid for Vulcan Materials (VMC +3.6%)...

    Martin Marietta (MLM +2.1%) will need to raise its takeover bid for Vulcan Materials (VMC +3.6%) by 40% to secure a deal, according to a Bloomberg analysis. VMC shares ended yesterday at $46.21, still 5.6% above MLM's takeover price; the premium indicates some investors are anticipating MLM will return with a higher bid now that the May injunction is over.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • ATVI

    NetEase (NTES +4.7%) pops thanks to an upgrade to Neutral from Nomura, which is pleased with...

    NetEase (NTES +4.7%) pops thanks to an upgrade to Neutral from Nomura, which is pleased with yesterday's announcement regarding the Oct. 2 arrival of a new expansion pack for the Chinese version of World of Warcraft, offered in partnership with Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI). Nomura sees the expansion pack, called Mists of Pandaria, slowing down the loss of World of Warcraft users, something NetEase blamed for its Q2 miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM

  • Shares of Cracker Barrel (CBRL +6.8%) pop after the restaurant operator beats profit estimates...

    Shares of Cracker Barrel (CBRL +6.8%) pop after the restaurant operator beats profit estimates with its FQ4 report and shows a healthy Y/Y rise in revenue. The company also boosted its dividend payout by 25% to $0.50 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • GLW

    Corning (GLW +2.9%) opens higher on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm sees Corning, which...

    Corning (GLW +2.9%) opens higher on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm sees Corning, which trades below book value, delivering positive EPS growth (on a Y/Y basis) for the first time in two years in Q4 thanks to stabilizing LCD glass fundamentals (the result of supply controls). It also expects the LCD business' share of net income to fall to 74% in 2013 from 96% in '09, and Corning''s FCF yield to grow to 6%. The demand environment for LCD TVs has been anything but pretty. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • ACHN

    BofA revises its stance on a pair of hepatitis-C drugmakers, raising Achillion Pharma...

    BofA revises its stance on a pair of hepatitis-C drugmakers, raising Achillion Pharma (NASDAQ:ACHN) to Buy and cutting Idenix Pharma (NASDAQ:IDIX) to Neutral. The firm is more optimistic on the market potential for ACHN’s hepatitis-C drug combo, and hikes its share price target to $13 from $7. But IDIX faces difficulties after the FDA placed a clinical hold on one of its hep-C treatments. ACHN +13.5%, IDIX -5.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures follow Europe and Asia higher after the BOJ joins the Fed, the ECB...

    Market preview: Stock futures follow Europe and Asia higher after the BOJ joins the Fed, the ECB and BOE in the "race to Debase" with an announcement of more asset buying. The S&P benchmark is +0.1% The move weakened the yen and boosted commodities, with gold hitting a six-month high, although it's now flat. Later: Existing Home Sales, Fed's Fisher
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACHN

    Premarket gainers: ACHN +12%. OTC:DCTH +9%. CPRX +9%. CBRL +7%. DRYS +7%. BVSN +6%. OTC:ANTH...

    Premarket gainers: ACHN +12%. OTC:DCTH +9%. CPRX +9%. CBRL +7%. DRYS +7%. BVSN +6%. OTC:ANTH +6%.
    Losers: IDIX -9%. GTAT -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACHN

    Deutsche Bank initiates coverage of Achillion (ACHN +12.35% to $9.10) with a "Buy" and gives the...

    Deutsche Bank initiates coverage of Achillion (ACHN +12.35% to $9.10) with a "Buy" and gives the company a price target of $12, saying it's unpartnered and under-appreciated. Deutsche Bank is confident about Achillion's hepatitus C drugs, and said it could be a takeover target. Meanwhile, BofA upgrades Achillion to a "Buy" from "Underperform."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Tech (GTAT) -8.5% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q3, seeing adjusted...

    GT Advanced Tech (GTAT) -8.5% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q3, seeing adjusted EPS of ($0.05)-$0.02 vs. $0.14 analyst consensus and revenues of $110M-$140M vs. $168M consensus, but reaffirms full-year guidance. GTAT warns of "significant consequences" for Chinese customers if the EU implements substantial tariffs on PV products from China.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • AREX

    Approach Resources (NASDAQ:AREX) intends to offer 5M shares as it seeks to raise funds to...

    Approach Resources (NASDAQ:AREX) intends to offer 5M shares as it seeks to raise funds to develop its Wolfcamp oil shale resource play and for general working capital needs; it may also use the proceeds to pay down debt. AREX had ~33.5M shares outstanding as of Sept. 17. Shares -1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • AZO

    Shares of AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) fall 3.6% premarket after the company beats estimates with its FQ4...

    Shares of AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) fall 3.6% premarket after the company beats estimates with its FQ4 report, but struck a somewhat cautious tone. Analyst Rahul Sharma says Autozone has lost its magic in a way, by not hitting the past trifecta of strong sales, margin, and cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian shares are broadly higher, given a shot in the arm by the BOJ's announcement of more money...

    Asian shares are broadly higher, given a shot in the arm by the BOJ's announcement of more money printing, with the Nikkei reaching its highest level in over four months. The move also weakened the yen, which is -0.4% vs. the dollar. Japanese  stocks +1.2%, Hong Kong +1.2%, China +0.4%, India -0.3%.
